column1: Group A: Perennial herbs or shrublets with a woody base
column2: stemless or with well developed stem. Stipules usually foliaceous. Corolla bright showy yellow; keel broad (limb of keels c. 3â€“10 mm wide)
column5: if keels less than 3 mm wide then wing longer than keels. Standard orbicular or elliptic. Calyx gibbose at the base
column6: at the teeth mouth open. Plants covered with basifixed hairs or rarely covered with medifixed hairs (section Caraganella).

column5: rarely caespitose. Plant covered only with basifixed hairs. Calyx closed at the teeth mouth. Corrola yellow or purplish. Keels narrow
column6: usually shorter than the wing-petals. Standard elliptic or oblong
column7: rarely orbicular. Vegetative parts covered with basifixed hairs.

column3: caulescent; stem rarely fistulate. Plant covered with basifixed or rarely medifixed hairs. Corolla yellow or purplish. Keels narrow
column4: usually shorter than the wing-petals. This group is usually growing in humid habitats or meadows. Pods ovoid

column2: covered with only basifixed hairs. Corolla yellow. Keel equaling or longer than wing petals. Keels ca. 6â€“9 mm wide
column3: limb longer than claw. Growing in China

column5: usually with dark violet punctat. Corolla always violet to purplish
column7: shorter than the wing-petals. With clear gum duct in some species. Claw of the keels and wings free from staminal tube. Calyx covered with black and white medifixed
column8: mixed with basifixed hairs or very rarely
column9: extremely asymmetric medifixed hairs. Pods bilocular

column4: with gum duct. Inflorescence pedunculate or synflorescence. Vegetative parts covered with basifixed hairs
column5: rarely covered with medifixed hairs (section Leucocercis). Leaves paripinate
column7: very rarely imparipinnate with a terminal leaflet. Corolla yellow or purplish. Keels narrow
column10: claw of the wing-petals and keels in different length adnate to the staminal tube. Pods unilocular or bilocular

column5: woody base. Covered with basifixed or medifixed hairs; symmetric or asymmetric. Leaves imparipinnate
column6: if in young age paripinnate then flowers pink or purplish. Flowers small
column7: closed. Corolla always violet to purplish
column9: shorter than the wing-petals. Without gum duct. Claw of the keels and wing free from staminal tube. Calyx covered with medifixed hairs mixed with basifixed hairs or only basifixed hairs or very rarely extremely asymmetric medifixed hairs. Pods bilocular.
